Class WarField

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.model.card.AdventureCard
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.model.card.WarField
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrewMemberRemover, DoubleCannonActivator, HowToDefend, PlayerMover

      public CardState getFirstState()

    • play

      public void play(PlayerChoicesDataStructure playerChoices)
      Executes gameplay logic based on the current state of the card and the choices made by the player.
      Specified by:
      play in class AdventureCard
      Parameters:
      playerChoices - the structure containing the player's choices such as selected cannons, engines, crew members, battery boxes, storage, or cabins, depending on the current game state. The provided choices will be used to perform the corresponding actions for the current state.

    • toClientCard

      public ClientCard toClientCard()
      Converts the current WarField instance into its corresponding ClientWarField object. This conversion includes transferring relevant properties such as card name, image name, malus values (crew, steps back, and cubes), and a list of dangerous objects. The dangerous objects are constructed by iterating through the shots in the WarField and creating corresponding ClientDangerousObject instances, which encapsulate the object type, direction, and a default coordinate value of -1.
      Specified by:
      toClientCard in class AdventureCard
      Returns:
      a ClientWarField object representing the client-side version of the WarField.

    • convertIdsToShots

      public void convertIdsToShots()
      Converts a list of shot IDs into corresponding Shot objects and initializes the shot iterator. This method processes the shot IDs stored in the `shotIDs` field, converts each ID into a Shot object using the `shotCreator.get(id).call()` method, and stores the resulting Shot objects into the `shots` field. If an exception occurs during the conversion of any ID, the method wraps and rethrows the exception as a RuntimeException. After the conversion, the method initializes the `shotIterator` field to iterate over the newly created shots. Throws: - RuntimeException: If an exception occurs while creating Shot objects from IDs.

    • checkShipBoardAfterAttack

      public void checkShipBoardAfterAttack()
      Evaluates the state of ship boards after an attack and determines the next state of the game. This method performs the following tasks: 1. Notifies players with invalid ship boards about the issues in their configurations by calling the gameModel.notifyInvalidShipBoards() method. 2. Checks whether all ships are correctly positioned using gameModel.areAllShipsCorrect(). 3. Based on the current game state, it transitions to the next state: - If there are remaining shots to be processed, the state transitions to CardState.THROW_DICES. - If the current phase is complete but there are more phases remaining, the player iterator is reset and the state transitions to the next phase. - If all phases and shots have been handled, the state transitions to CardState.END_OF_CARD, resets the player iterator, and sets the game state to GameState.CHECK_PLAYERS. This method interacts with the game model and other components to ensure the game progresses appropriately after handling ship board evaluations.
